metadata.Title: CVE-2019-5721 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
In Wireshark 2.4.0 to 2.4.11, the ENIP dissector could crash. This was addressed in epan/dissectors/packet-enip.c by changing the memory-management approach so that a use-after-free is avoided.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-5721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwireshark-data - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwireshark11 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwiretap8 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwscodecs2 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
libwsutil9 - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
tshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-common - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-gtk - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
wireshark-qt - 2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: wireshark package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.6.5-1~ubuntu18.04.1').
